Name: Tetradrachm of Ptolemy VIII
Description: Tetradrachm of Ptolemy VIII minted in Paphos (Cyprus). Anverse: head of a king (Ptolemy I?) with diadem and aegis, on the right. Reverse: eagle above thunderbolt, on the left; in the field, on the left LNG., on the right PA. Mintage's position: 12.00 hours.
